body.p: A random sample of 160 households is selected to estimate the mean amount spent on electric service. A 95% confidence interval was determined from the sample results to be ($151, $216). Which of the following is the correct interpretation of this interval?

input.choice: We are 95% confident that the mean amount spent on electric service among the 160 households is between $151 and $216.
95% of the households will have an electric bill between $151 and $216.
We are 95% confident that the mean amount spent on electric service among all households is between $151 and $216.
There is a 95% chance that the mean amount spent on electric service is between $151 and $216.

response.feedback: Incorrect. This statement refers to the sample of 160 households. A confidence interval is an inference about the population parameter not the sample results.
Incorrect. Remember we are 95% confident that the interval will contain the population parameter in the long run, not that 95% of households will fall in one specific interval.
Correct. This statement refers to the population of all households and is the correct interpretation of the 95% confidence interval.
Incorrect. Remember we are 95% confident that the interval will contain the population parameter in the long run, not that there is a 95% chance the parameter will fall in one specific interval.
